unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches**
normalised: Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity recently with manufacturers rolling out exciting new models. Dr. A.P.J. Kalam Technological University's Automotive Engineering department highlighted key trends at a recent seminar in Thiruvananthapuram.
normalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity recently with manufacturers rolling out exciting new models. Doctor A. P. J. Kalam Technological University's Automotive Engineering department highlighted key trends at a recent seminar in Thiruvananthapuram.

unnormalised: Several companies, including Tata Motors and Mahindra, launched upgraded versions of existing models, focusing on enhanced fuel efficiency, with some claiming figures surpassing 25 kmpl.
normalised: Several companies, including Tata Motors and Mahindra, launched upgraded versions of existing models, focusing on enhanced fuel efficiency, with some claiming figures surpassing twenty five kilometer per liter.

unnormalised: The buzz surrounds the increasing adoption of hybrid and electric vehicle technology. Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled plans for a new electric vehicle manufacturing plant in Gujarat, spanning 100,000 sq ft.
normalised: The buzz surrounds the increasing adoption of hybrid and electric vehicle technology. Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled plans for a new electric vehicle manufacturing plant in Gujarat, spanning one hundred thousand square feet.

unnormalised: Expect to see Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS) becoming more commonplace, even in mid-range vehicles. Mahindra's new SUV boasts Level 2 autonomy features.
normalised: Expect to see Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (A D A S) becoming more commonplace, even in mid-range vehicles. Mahindra's new S U V boasts Level two autonomy features.

unnormalised: Industry analysts suggest that while the entry-level segment remains price-sensitive, consumers are increasingly willing to pay a premium for advanced features and enhanced safety.
normalised: Industry analysts suggest that while the entry-level segment remains price-sensitive, consumers are increasingly willing to pay a premium for advanced features and enhanced safety.

unnormalised: Bookings for the new vehicles are being accepted at dealerships and online, with initial down payments starting from Rs. 25,000.
normalised: Bookings for the new vehicles are being accepted at dealerships and online, with initial down payments starting from rupee twenty five thousand.

unnormalised: These launches indicate a positive outlook for the Indian automotive sector, boosted by both domestic demand and export opportunities.
normalised: These launches indicate a positive outlook for the Indian automotive sector, boosted by both domestic demand and export opportunities.
